instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01040: What is 820-01040? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01040</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Blown SSD module.
threads.message: Got a board that wasn't powering up, missing 20v supply. Isolated to blown <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>. Replaced the blown chip and now have 20v power, but board still won't power up. Isolated to <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with a short, about 1.5ohms on <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> line. After removing <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, resistance on that line is now 20ohms. Is this too lower or normal? If normal, can i disable <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> so that i can leave the chip out of the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01040</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Blown SSD module.
threads.message:
The board cannot boot without SSD.
T2 has its firmware partition there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01040</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Blown SSD module.
threads.message: Yeah figured that was going to be an issue. If I replace the ssd modules with another from identical board, will I run into issues with the T2 firmware bricking the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01040</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Blown SSD module.
threads.message:
You will have problems with SSD controller and its ROM; must replace them too.
T2-SSD issue probably may be solved through DFU.
